alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 4:05PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Pike and southern Montgomery Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 404 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sprague, or near Meadville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Montgomery, Troy, Meadville, Pine Level, Kent, Strata, Dublin, Naftel, Linwood, Snowdoun, Sprague, Ansley, Grady, Sellers, Pinedale, Troy Municipal Airport, Ramer, Troy University, Lapine and Pintlala. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
